item.title: Chicago Homicide Clearance Rate
item.author: rszumski@gmail.com (Russell Szumski)
item.description: If you’re murdered in America, there’s a 1 in 3 chance that the police won’t identify your killer. To use the FBI’s terminology, the national “clearance rate” for homicide today is 64.1 percent. Fifty years ago, it was more than 90 percent. From 2001 to 2017, of the 8913 homicides in Chicago, the average percent of homicides that resulted in an arrest was just under 49. The number of homicides has spiked in recent years while the arrest rate decreased.
